intro: Uragoga foetida, commonly known as the stinking nightshade, is a herbaceous plant native to certain regions of South America. It belongs to the Solanaceae family, which includes other nightshades like tomatoes and potatoes. The plant is characterized by its dark green, hairy leaves and small, bell-shaped flowers that range in color from white to purple. Its fruits are berries that turn from green to yellow or red as they mature. Uragoga foetida is known for its strong, unpleasant odor, which is most noticeable when the plant is in bloom.
